definitions.definition: communicate information, facts, or news to someone in spoken or written words.
examples: I told her you were coming
synonyms: warn; informalclue in/up "why didn't you tell me before?"relate

definitions.definition: order, instruct, or advise (someone) to do something.
synonyms: require; literarybid "she told him to leave"

definitions.definition: narrate or relate (a tale or story).
reveal (information) to someone in a nonverbal way.
examples: the figures tell a different story
synonyms: signify "the figures tell a different story"
let the cat out of the bag

definitions.definition: inform someone of the misdemeanors of.
examples: friends don't tell on each other
synonyms: sell out; Moreinformalblow the whistle on
finger "she was bound to tell on him"

definitions.definition: decide or determine correctly or with certainty.
examples: you can tell they're in love
synonyms: comprehend; Moreinformalfigure out; informalsuss out "it was hard to tell what he said"

definitions.definition: distinguish (one person or thing) from another; perceive (the difference) between one person or thing and another.
examples: I can't tell the difference between margarine and butter
synonyms: discriminate "he couldn't tell one from the other"

definitions.definition: (of an experience or period of time) have a noticeable, typically harmful, effect on someone.
examples: the strain of supporting the family was beginning to tell on him
synonyms: leave its mark; affect "the strain began to tell on him"

definitions.definition: (of a particular factor) play a part in the success or otherwise of someone or something.
examples: lack of fitness told against him on his first run of the season

definitions.definition: count (the members of a series or group).
examples: the shepherd had told all his sheep
